issue.title: Make sure our memory usage is low enough to use a Standard-2x dyno

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
If we use a Standard-2x dyno, we crash while cloning mozilla-central:
```
2020-03-06T10:01:30.905674+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-06 10:01:30,905:INFO:bugbug_http.boot:Cloning mozilla-central in /tmp/bugbug-hg...
2020-03-06T10:08:14.456259+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=1484M(144.6%)
2020-03-06T10:08:14.456466+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:08:32.835085+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=1654M(158.6%)
2020-03-06T10:08:32.835150+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:08:53.580686+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=1838M(169.0%)
2020-03-06T10:08:53.580798+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:09:13.675078+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=1959M(179.8%)
2020-03-06T10:09:13.675226+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:09:33.801092+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=1980M(185.9%)
2020-03-06T10:09:33.801173+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:09:53.841634+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=2127M(198.4%)
2020-03-06T10:09:53.841634+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R14 (Memory quota exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:10:13.904876+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Process running mem=2106M(204.2%)
2020-03-06T10:10:13.905040+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Error R15 (Memory quota vastly exceeded)
2020-03-06T10:10:13.905199+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: Stopping process with SIGKILL
2020-03-06T10:10:14.225164+00:00 heroku[worker.1]: State changed from up to crashed
```

If we use a Performance-M one, we're all good.

It's strange because on code-review we are doing mostly the same thing (using robustcheckout to clone), but we are *not* running out of memory with a Standard-2x.

Moreover, if we look at the memory usage on Heroku, we see that when we have a Standard-2x we use more memory (> 2 GB) that when we have a Performance-M (~1,8 GB). If we had the same memory usage, we'd be good with Standard-2x:
![wtf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1616846/76076765-c6532d00-5f9f-11ea-9dcd-a5400e0bdff1.png)

body: I'll dive into this on Monday

The simple fact that [there is a dedicated official article](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/node-memory-use) on debugging memory leaks on Heroku is intriguing. The article is aimed at NodeJs developers (and specific tooling) so not really useful here.

After team meeting:

1. try to get an [ssh connection on the host](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/exec) and run top to see what is using memory
2. check number of threads
3. use [pympler](https://github.com/pympler/pympler)  locally to see where the memory is going in worker mode bh,n

> Found by @calixteman : https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/tuning-glibc-memory-behavior

This is also interesting, but the strange thing is that it's not a problem of peak memory usage, but it seems as if there is something lingering around using memory even when we are not doing anything.

I've tried to set MALLOC_ARENA_MAX, let's see what happens.
Another easy thing we could try is using a different allocator, such as jemalloc.

jemalloc helped a lot: memory usage (on a Performance-M) on idle went from ~1,3 GB to ~100 MB.

I'm trying switching to Standard-2X again to see if we have the same improvement there or if we have to tune jmalloc a bit (in particular, the number of arenas [narenas] is 4 times the number of CPUs, and on Standard-2X we have more CPUs than on Performance-M).

![memusage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1616846/78794145-a3a7a000-79b3-11ea-81b4-ca84a12a070b.png)

So yes, there is some tuning needed to get us to the same mem usage of Performance-M, but I think we can call this issue fixed (with 45be290): the memory usage was high because of malloc.

issue.title: Lower memory usage so that we can use Standard-1X

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body: See #1421. We should be able to lower the peak memory usage to under 1 GB and then use Standard-1X instead of Standard-2X.

issue.title: Use jemalloc in the Heroku worker image

repository.name: code-review
repository.description: Automated static analysis & linting bot for Mozilla repositories

issue.body:
The improvements for bugbug were huge: https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1421.

With enough tuning, we might be able to use Standard-1X (https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1472).

issue.title: events: Use jemalloc to reduce RAM usage on Heroku

repository.name: code-review
repository.description: Automated static analysis & linting bot for Mozilla repositories

issue.body:
Fixes #573 & clone of https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1421

I'm pushing the PR to testing to test the memory reduction
